skill.name: simplify
skill.description: Simplify and refine recently modified code for clarity and consistency. Use after writing code to improve readability without changing functionality.
skill.summary: Refine recently modified code for clarity and consistency while preserving exact functionality.
skill.author: brianlovin

security_audit.summary: All 8 static findings evaluated as false positives. The skill contains only documentation and coding standards references with no actual external commands, network code, or cryptographic algorithms. Safe for publication.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded HTTP URL Reference
low_findings.description: Documentation references http://CLAUDE.md without HTTPS. This is a documentation URL reference, not network code execution.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: URL is a documentation reference, not network code. No network requests are made by the skill.

content.value_statement: Codebases accumulate technical debt over time. This skill simplifies recently modified code to improve readability and consistency without changing functionality.
actual_capabilities: Refine recently modified code for clarity and consistency
Apply project-specific coding standards and best practices
Simplify code structure by reducing unnecessary complexity
Eliminate redundant code and improve naming conventions
Preserve exact functionality while enhancing code quality
limitations: Only refines code that has been recently modified or touched in the current session
Does not perform broad codebase-wide refactoring
Cannot modify external dependencies or configuration files
Does not add new functionality or change program behavior

use_cases.title: Post-Write Code Refinement
use_cases.description: After implementing a new feature, use this skill to clean up the code before committing. It applies consistent coding standards and improves readability.
use_cases.target_user: Software developers who want to maintain code quality

use_cases.title: Technical Debt Reduction
use_cases.description: Gradually improve code clarity during regular development by refining modified sections. Each refinement builds toward a more maintainable codebase.

use_cases.title: Codebase Standard Enforcement
use_cases.description: Ensure all new code follows project conventions. The skill references established standards from CLAUDE.md to maintain consistency.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Simplification
prompt_templates.prompt: Simplify the code you just wrote. Apply project coding standards and improve readability without changing functionality.
prompt_templates.scenario: After writing new code and wanting immediate cleanup

prompt_templates.title: Refine Complex Logic
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the recent changes and simplify any complex logic. Use switch statements instead of nested ternaries and make the code easier to understand.
prompt_templates.scenario: When code has become difficult to read or overly nested

prompt_templates.title: Apply Naming Conventions
prompt_templates.prompt: Improve variable and function names in the recent code. Make them clear and descriptive while following project naming conventions.
prompt_templates.scenario: When variable names are unclear or inconsistent

prompt_templates.title: Consolidate Redundant Code
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify and eliminate redundant code in the recent changes. Consolidate repeated logic into shared helpers where appropriate.
prompt_templates.scenario: When code contains duplicate or repetitive patterns

output_examples.input: Complex nested conditional with ternary operators
output_examples.output: Refactored code using a switch statement or if/else chain that is easier to read and maintain

output_examples.input: Code with overly terse variable names
output_examples.output: Code with clear, descriptive names that explain the purpose and intent of each variable
Consistent function declarations following project standards with proper type annotations

best_practices: Use the skill after each significant code change rather than waiting for large cleanup sessions
Review the simplified code to ensure it still matches your original intent
Combine with other skills like documentation generation for complete code improvement
anti_patterns: Using the skill on code that has not been recently modified
Expecting the skill to add new functionality or change behavior
Applying overly aggressive simplification that reduces code clarity
Skipping manual review of the simplified output

faq.question: Does this skill change my code functionality?
faq.answer: No. The skill explicitly preserves all original functionality. It only refactors how the code achieves the same result.

faq.question: How recent must code be for simplification?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on code modified in the current session. For older code, explicitly request a broader review.

faq.question: Does this skill modify multiple files at once?
faq.answer: No. The skill operates on recently modified code within the current context, typically within a single file.

faq.question: What coding standards does this skill follow?
faq.answer: The skill references standards from CLAUDE.md, including ES modules, explicit return types, and React component patterns.

faq.question: Can I customize the coding standards this skill uses?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill applies standards from your project. Configure CLAUDE.md with your preferred conventions.

faq.question: What if I disagree with the simplifications suggested?
faq.answer: Review the changes and manually adjust any suggestions. The skill provides a starting point for refinement.
